PageTitle: peer default-route-advertise(BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view)(IPv6)
FuncDef:
The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise only default routes to a peer.
The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default setting. The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise only default routes to a peer. The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default setting. By default, a BGP device does not advertise any default route to its peer. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view,BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv6 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a peer.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the name of the route-policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Configures the device to send the default route when all conditional routes are matched.
-

Configures the device to send the default route when any conditional route is matched.
-

Specifies the IPv6 address of a conditional route.
The format is X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the IPv6 mask length of a conditional route.
It is an integer ranging from 0 to 128.

ExtraInfo: Generally, default routes are used on networks that have the following characteristics:
